summary: This is an email chain from December 29, 2008, involving Assistant U.S. Attorney (USAFLS) and defense attorneys. It discusses the process for victims to have their addresses added to Jeffrey Epstein's GPS monitoring exclusionary zones, with assurance from law enforcement that the information will remain confidential and not be provided to Epstein.

persons.name: Robert C. Josefsberg
persons.context: Listed as a recipient of the email regarding the process for adding victims' addresses to Epstein's GPS exclusion zones.

persons.name: Katherine W. Ezell
persons.context: Contacted the Assistant U.S. Attorney to inquire about confidentiality of victim information for Epstein's GPS monitoring.

persons.name: Brad Edwards
persons.context: Listed as a recipient of the email regarding the GPS exclusion zone process for Epstein's victims.

persons.name: Jeffrey Epstein
persons.context: The subject of the email chain; his GPS monitoring system and the confidentiality of victim addresses being added to exclusionary zones are discussed.

persons.name: Captain Sleeth
persons.context: A captain from the Palm Beach Sheriff's Office who informs the AUSA that victim information for Epstein's GPS exclusion zones will remain confidential and not be provided to Epstein.

connections.description: Ezell is contacting the AUSA on behalf of her client, Jeffrey Epstein, regarding the GPS monitoring conditions.
Captain Sleeth, from the Palm Beach Sheriff's Office, is responsible for managing the GPS exclusion zones for Epstein as part of his monitoring.
Josefsberg is listed as a recipient of legal correspondence regarding Epstein's case, indicating he is part of Epstein's defense team.
Edwards is listed as a recipient of legal correspondence regarding Epstein's case, indicating he is part of Epstein's defense team.

events.title: Email Correspondence on GPS Exclusion Zones
events.description: Assistant U.S. Attorney communicates with Epstein's defense attorneys regarding the process for victims to have their addresses added to Epstein's GPS monitoring exclusionary zones, with assurances of confidentiality.

keyFacts: Jeffrey Epstein was under GPS monitoring with 'exclusionary zones' as part of his legal conditions.
Victims could request their work, school, or home addresses be added to Epstein's GPS exclusion list to prevent him from approaching.
Captain Sleeth of the Palm Beach Sheriff's Office assured that victim information for the GPS zones would remain confidential and not be provided to Epstein.
All requests for address additions were to be routed through the Assistant U.S. Attorney rather than directly to law enforcement.
The email shows coordination between the U.S. Attorney's Office, Palm Beach Sheriff's Office, and Epstein's defense team regarding his monitoring conditions.
